dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mist. Dark trees.     Dripping vines.        An ENGINE RU distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The full moon shimmers on a puddle.          A FROG SPLAT splashing a one man pup tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUKE's eyes pop open, disoriented, realizing he's fallen asleep reading by flashlight. He's nineteen, still slight awkward and unaware he's growing handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens as the ENGINE RUMBLES LOUDER, closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peers out through the tent flap. Glaring head lamps RO toward him. Scrambling out of his sleeping bag, he HURLS himself against the side of the tent, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an RV CAMPER nearly plows down the tent, skidding to a st in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke extricates himself from the tent.          He runs t side window of the RV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, ALEXA, thirties, earthy, looks up at him bleary-e She nods 'yes.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you even get here?       There's no road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     I'm from Utah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alone out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods 'yes.'    She bursts into TEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband. Bastard. I've been driving for days. I don't even know where I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow.    I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers herself, sniffling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have warm apple kringel in the camper. Would you like some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pastry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stands at the RV's tiny kitchen counter, wolfing pas off a paper plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this "Survival Quest" is your vacation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's my third try.     Kind a' lame, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Seven days alone in the wilderness?   I'd be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just something I really wanted to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke notices an odd pile of stuff by the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shoes. Fishing lures.        The electric drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, grateful, eyeing his torn t-shirt and shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all wet and muddy. Why don't I hang those up to dry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.    I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm propositioning you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Oh, wow. You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He considers, fearful, but thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students crisscross on bikes in front of the quadrangle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge round headlights and muscular front grill of an SEMI-TRUCK RUMBLES up to the curb. It's the cab only, lik the sliced-off front of a train engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke hops down, startling his friends, KEENAN and JANINE, passionately making out on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty, brainy and athletic, Janine adjusts her glasses, only remnant of a bookish past, as she thoughtfully consi Luke's massive truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's remarkable. Sort of retro. I thought you were gettin' a pickup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoping for a more enthusiastic response, he turns to Keen who climbs up and peeks inside the cab. He's rugged, streetwise, perpetually bemused, -maybe Ed Norton and Bil Murray had a son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's awesome. It's pleather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.    You think it's stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs, trying to put her finger on it, and when Luke rolls up his T-shirt sleeves, she grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. You got laid. Finally! Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke glares at Keenan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say a word! I swear!     You know Janine. She's got X-ray vision. (to Janine) Camping! A total stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew that whole "waitin' to meet the right girl" thing was crap. Congratulations! I have to get to Physics. The truck's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya', hottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could find something to call me, other than what every guy in the world would say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sweetheart?" "Babe?" "Aphrodite?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine sneers.    At a loss, Keenan grabs her and kisses passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off rolling her eyes, but secretly loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan climbs up into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is gonna' be like your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know it's dopey. But don't you recognize it? It's painted and the muffler's switched out, -but this was my dad's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan looks around with fresh eyes. He reaches an arm wa up under the glove box and GRINS, pulling out a small sta of weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years.     A little dried out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck barrels along through the trees.     Luke and K share a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, that woman. We didn't go all the way, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   Okay, so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think technically I'm still a virgin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you inside her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It counts.     Next.   ...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been havin' this weird dream. The thing is, I think maybe the dream's real. Forget it. No way I'm tellin' you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know enough of my secrets to get me shot. Sharon's mom on Thanksgiving? What the fuck dream is there you can't tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about part of me gettin' smaller. An important part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan looks over warily, then busts out LAUGHING, then realizes Luke's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have gotta' be fuckin' kiddin' me. You're not thirteen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you.     Maybe I caught something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's good you bought this truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, run-down service garage, crammed with tires, too and discarded car parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's truck idles in the service bay, billowing smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX, nineteen, lean, in overalls, with shoulder-length ha and edgy eyes, wipes his greasy hands on a rag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dripping with masculinity, he swaggers around the truck, chewing gum, wielding a pneumatic torque-wrench, which he occasionally REVS for emphasis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do the gasket for twenty bucks. But new T-sprocks, for this thing? Two, three hundred, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.    Can I hold off on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No skin off my ass. But a few days, weeks, your whole transmission could blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Jeez.     I shouldn't got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max considers, sets his baseball cap on the truck fender SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred seventy-five horsepower. Twenty-eight inch wheels. It's a classic. Let me dig around out back. Maybe we got a used set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be great.   Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max disappears through a squeaky door at the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke picks up a rag and wipes fingerprints off the fender

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits, impatient for Max to return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He examines Max's cap, tries it on. He picks up the torqu wrench, swaggers about, trying to look macho, in the mann of Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins around and REVS the wrench, catching sight of MICHELLE, twenty, watching him from out front in jeans an shirt, with warm, confident eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke swallows, wide-eyed, a deer in headlights.   He sets down the torque-wrench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my wrench. It's my truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just needs a new gasket and a couple T-sprocks. The flanges are sheared off.   No big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to watch my brother, Max. He's sellin' you "T-sprocks?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing. Last week he sold Mrs. Gustafson a whole set: six hundred bucks. My name's Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From New York. Poli-Sci transfer. I sort of asked around campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've prob'ly already got a stalker, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stares, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard about Cafe Lunizia? Italian? They got New York style pizza. Make you feel at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You askin' me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, uh, -definitely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An SUV pulls up at the gas pump, stuffed with Keenan and OTHER GUYS. CHAD, exuding supreme self-confidence, calls over to Luke as he pumps gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Spanky, let's go! Look forward to kickin' your puck ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name's "Spanky?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Puck Ass, but people just call me Luke. We're beatin' his frat boy team in street hockey. Pisses 'em off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to Max. Tell him to just replace the gasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's BREATHING grows HEAVIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. So, what do you think? I'll just sit there while you eat. I won't even talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I just split up with this total amoeba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm a paramecium. That's way more evolved. I'm practically pond scum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll give you a call when the truck's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.    You mean to go out, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle smiles, and walks out through the squeaky door a the back. Keenan approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Whoa. That was her!     Jesus, you're sweatin' like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke sits, nods 'yes,' wipes BEADS of SWEAT from his brow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're goin' out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan gives him a high-five.    Luke smiles, catching hi breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. LUKE & KEENAN'S PLACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, run-down house. Hockey gear, dirty laundry and Keenan are strewn across the garage-sale sofa. He munches burrito while watching the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEENAN!   COME HERE, QUICK!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan leaps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races down the hall, sliding on the linoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, a towel around his waist, stares at himself in the mirror, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!   My chest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan looks, clueless, a little uncomfortable now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had hair. Come on! Not a lot, but you've seen me -some- right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I don't know.    So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan takes a bite of the burrito in his hand, now mashe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really thought you gettin' laid was gonna' help. What is it with you, man? I mean, you're smarter than me, you're better lookin' than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But I'm just sayin', you can get any girl you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy for you, you've got Janine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still workin' on my GED. How long you think Brainiac's gonna' wanna' hang with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She worships you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I'm gonna' be that wild fling she had with the local dude from the bike shop. "God, what was his name?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan gives him a look of "I'm crazy?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna' have a great time with her tonight. Just be yourself. ...Mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap elegance. Luke and Michelle dine on the patio, stru with far too many white lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I caught him with my best friend. Former. Such a cliche'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winthrop Hawkins. "Hawk." From this Park Avenue family. He'd know what kind of mushrooms those are, what the best wine is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best wine is beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm such a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I am.    I have incontrovertible proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks off her shoe and sticks her bare foot on the ta a TATTOO of a GREEN BIRD on her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hawk. Get it? "Hawkins?" See, you're smirking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's GREEN! That's the one color tattoo they can't REMOVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Bummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm considering a prosthetic foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sip from their glasses and drink each other in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke contemplates a kiss,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but his breathing grows shallow, he GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'. Maybe just kind a' hot out here. You want moron? When my dad died, -it's okay, I was nine. I barely knew what was goin' on- But I thought the tombstone was really sad looking, so I painted smiley faces and fish all over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sure dad would've loved that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face REDDENS. Overheated, Luke tugs at his shirt, brushes SWEAT from his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you think makes a good relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real? I don't know. Friendship. Great sex. Knowing you want to be there even when it gets scary or bloody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.     Where'd that come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just not the usual guy thing. ...You're great, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke puts his hand on his chest, FEELS something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, puts on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you excuse me a sec'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HYPER-VENTILATING, his arms CLUTCHING HIS CHEST,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEADS OF SWEAT on his forehead,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke checks the Men's Room door: LOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ducks out the service entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the dumpster, Luke reaches behind his head, WHIPS off jacket and shirt, and looks down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes GO WIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -AAH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his chest: FEMALE BREASTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two WAITERS come outside for a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Table twenty-nine. Like to bring her the cannoli special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke peers over the dumpster, down at his breasts, with a HIGH FEVER, and PASSES OUT, slumping to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's eyes open, dilated, disoriented. He's lying on the ground, shirtless among bits of garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches bleary-eyed, as a MOUSE peers at him from insi an empty milk carton. The mouse runs over and sniffs at a canteloupe, which triggers Luke's memory:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He GRABS his chest, relieved to find it's back to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, dizzy, surveying the dark, locked restaurant, staggers across the deserted parking lot toward his truck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's Semi THUNDERS along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stares out in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears HEAVY BREATHING, MOANS, VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes!   Don't stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around for the source of the sounds, glances ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in it's reflection a leering male, stripped to the waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down for me, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD LAMPS of an oncoming car FLASH at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he glances out the driver-side window, MUSIC BLARES fr the passing car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glimpse of what might be an ORGY of BODIES intertwined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FEMALE DRIVER - GRINS MANIACALLY UP at Luke as the CA HORN SCREAMS by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke CAREENS to one side, glancing at the truck's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car recedes in the distance, but the Female Driver appears CLOSE in the mirror's reflection, LEERING. She LI THE MIRROR from the inside, and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stares out, EYES GLAZED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decrepit old garage looks as if it may collapse any second. Barbells on the floor. Luke dodges and weaves, slugging a makeshift punching bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan appears, wiping sleep from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We takin' up boxing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on? You competin' for Mr. Universe this week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone should just mind their own fucking business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan recoils at the attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't go so great, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke punches the bag, harder and faster, a near SEIZURE: RAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He collapses in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was goin' great. She's amazing. Funny. And really smart.    And the way she eats ravioli, like 'aah.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I started feelin' all weird again, and,... oh, man, you'll think I'm nuts... Keen, I had breasts. I felt 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, first date.     Definitely the 'new Luke!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!     On me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're startin' to creep me out. Listen, I think I know what's goin' on, okay? "Acute Adolescent Anxiety." It's from the stress of college, girls, grades. It's really common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an adolescent.    Where'd you get this crap?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Net. I found all the symptoms right off: panic attacks, "Localized Alopecia" -that's hair loss. This doctor wrote back, "Any chance your friend, Luke, just lost his virginity?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told, -you gave him my name?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a doctor, back East. He's sending this information pack. Look, I started thinkin' you're goin' bipolar on me or somethin'. Come on, man, BREASTS?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke hops down from the truck cab, fixes his shirt and ha trying to look nonchalant as he rings the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing something behind him, he turns as Max PUNCHES him the stomach, knocking the wind out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch, stay the hell away from my sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke GASPS for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say a word?! You just leave her sittin' there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max shoves him across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out a' here!   She's not home, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you tell her I came by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's honest with you, so you bolt? And then what, you wake up feelin' sorry for her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Is that what she thinks?   I left 'cause a' what she said? That's crazy! She's like the most incredible girl I ever met!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sneers, skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had this 'pasta quattro funghi' - four mushroom. It took me a while to even figure it out, but I think someone put shrooms in it, or somehow they got in there by mistake. I was hallucinating and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazes even me, a guy's capacity to be a world-class asshole. Fortunately, I'm familiar with the cause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please just tell her I came by? Forget it. I'll catch up with her on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    You won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm gonna' see her again, -if she'll see me. I don't care what the fuck you say about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They face off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get near her, I'll feed your nuts to the neighbor's dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind a' dog is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, is it a pitbull, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught off guard, a smile escapes Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm crazy about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrooms, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your deal?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ASSHOLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke lunges for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go at it, wrestling FIERCELY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max gets the upper hand, and pins Luke down to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke surges with RAGE, breaks free. Grit teeth, ripped clothes, they roll on top of each other, two rabid pitbul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan and the Other Guys rush in, pulling them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the fuck away from me!     And Michelle too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's goin' on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guys) Luke's datin' his sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognition) Aaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you can all fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke breaks free of the guys, and moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney stands at the bar with a cup of coffee, chatting w Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shirt? I've had it for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's very sexy. I love men's clothes. What else have you got in your closet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy smiles, unsure what she means. When Polly approach her eyes a little red, Jeremy pulls her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly, are you alright?   Didn't mean to walk in on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hon. I'm fine, thanks. Love, tears. That's the trade-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a hand to his cheek, reassuring.    Jeremy ducks behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, he's gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he's a Michelangelo. And the sweetest boy in the world. Sorry, darling, I'm afraid you'll find he's not your type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we'll see about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he may prefer men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan and Janine enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two better have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Luke alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should have full control over this now. Something must be really confusing him. The only thing I can think of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he became Luca, was he attracted to one of you? You can get really thrown by that. Janine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he sure as hell wasn't attracted to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Definitely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't it just the two of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine glances to Keenan, as his eyes GO WIDE, grossed ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, give me a break! No way! Max?! They just had a huge fight. He tried to beat the crap out of him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine and Sydney exchange a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ, Luke's not queer!   He was just turnin' into a girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.   He was a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!   This is just wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather she was attracted to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I would!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! HANG ON! Right now, Luke needs your help. He needs to know you're behind him, no matter what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's all this mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom line? Maybe Luca really likes this boy, -enough to want to be female.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Keenan) Don't sneer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on! I know the guy. We've done all kinds a' shit together: Hoops, hockey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and girls can't play sports?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, -whatever! Christ, Janine! Why the hell would he want to be a girl?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so hard to imagine?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, -YEAH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY! LISTEN UP! I know what I'm talking about. You see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney pulls out a SNAPSHOT, shows it to Janine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he?     An Ex?   ...Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one too? You're a Z? You're a guy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was.   I made a terrible mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Keenan keep staring at the photo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once you finally figure out who you are, it's a horrible thing not being yourself. That's why it's crucial we help Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine nods, grasping the significance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan keeps looking from the photo to Sydney and back ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You musta' worked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke sits, waiting on the steps of a campus dormitory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine approaches, grinning, carrying a box tied with a b Keenan trails behind, straddling his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine hands him the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan sneers, cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a little something we thought you might want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke opens it, pulls out a BLUE DRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (elated) I told her. (to Janine) I told ya'. What a stupid ass idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keen! Don't! We just want you to know, whatever you decide, it's all right with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decide?! WHAT?! No, it's not! Get this thing away from me! JUDAS PRIEST!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke HURLS the box out to the curb.    Keenan gives him a thumbs up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. Think she wishes everyone was female.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that s'posed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ, Janine! It means he doesn't want to be girl!   Like he'd have to think about THAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There happen to be millions of us out there that like being female!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, bully for YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine walks over to pick up the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! I want to know! Just exactly what's wrong with being a girl?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'! It's great!    It's fuckin' PHENOMENAL, if you happen to BE one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should've had this conversation the other afternoon?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't my choice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure as hell didn't make you do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine, will you just let me talk to him for a sec'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what?! It's a 'GUY THING?!' Give me a fuckin' break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine storms off with the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. She talked me into it. You know Janine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan picks up his bike, gets on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, uh,... you do like bein' a dude, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan GRINS, rides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back) You should thank me.    The one she picked out was PINK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke passes a sidewalk trash can and notices the gift box mangled inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glancing around to make sure no one's watching, he pulls dress out, brushes off some dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves it back in the trash, stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke kneels on the floor, stocking candy shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHIME BINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peers over the aisle, looks around, no one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle appears by the soda dispenser, wary of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.     How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.     You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they talk, Michelle maneuvers to get closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke maneuvers to keep his distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.     You look really nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.    I was hopin' you might call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I need to talk to you about. -But did I do something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nothin' like that. There's just some stuff I've got to sort out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gaze at each other across the magazine rack,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a mountain range of silence between them,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing you can't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. What did you want to talk to me about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand silent, beneath the hum of fluorescent lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing really.   So, heard you and Max really got into it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I kind a' lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows how to push buttons, huh? What exactly did he say that got you so pissed off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We'd just finished a game. I was all revved up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's actually a really nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure he's too crazy about me seein' his sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he scare you off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he doesn't "scare" me. What, his struttin' around, thinkin' he's such a bad ass, with his shirt hangin' open half the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's surprised and embarrassed by his own words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle steps away, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just an act. He likes pretending he's Joe Cool. Always says you gotta' just be whatever you want, and fuck 'em if they can't take a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's a joke alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not sure this is gonna' work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I didn't mean-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can't do this. I'm not sure you even know who you are. Much less who I am. Have you ever even had a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you think my brother's such a "joke," how much better could you think of me? We're not that different, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're totally different.    He's a guy, for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's my best friend. If you don't like him, you can't like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke kneels in the aisle, stocking shelves, distracted, fidgety, distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances up at the magazine rack. A Female Fitness magazine catches his attention. The BEAUTIFUL COVER model seems to MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at it: no movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke approaches the rack, and flips over the magazine cov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he steps away, he glances back at the rack,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ADONIS on the cover comes to life. He rips off his sh as he moves off one magazine cover and into another, wher passionately kisses the BIKINI-CLAD COVER MODEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MODELS AND OTHERS on half a dozen covers begin stripp down, moving to other magazines and making out with each other all across the rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows glow among the dark trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, Luke rips up covers, HURLING magazine after magaz across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle leans against the shower wall, staring at the sp of water, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam rises, filling the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins SINGING, longingly,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I wanna know how to go To the inside of love. I can't find my way through."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washing herself,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: behind the shower curtain,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the timbre of her singing voice mysteriously shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As her hand turns the shower faucet, it changes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm outside of love, To the side or above, I can't find my way with you"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glimpse of her shoulder behind the shower curtain, grow more muscular,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and her voice begins LOWERING IN PITCH,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as MICHELLE BECOMES MAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Must be a special view, Finding a me with a you, On the inside of love."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max steps out of the shower, and towels off in the mirror

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ORLANDO'S BED & BREAKFAST - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A persistent KNOCK on the door. Sydney pulls on a robe ov a pair of men's boxers, wiping sleep from her eyes. She swings the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stands outside in POURING RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey.     Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney pours hot tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one too.    Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to confuse the issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, it's true what you said? You really know. I wouldn't change unless I wanted to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some part of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part?    How much of me? I mean, for it to work? Half? More than half? What if it was only a tiny bit, -a thought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I believe there may be thousands of Z's out there, millions for all we know, go their whole lives without even knowing they are one. Nothing ever happens. You couldn't keep it from happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love being with Michelle. How come I can't control it when she's around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think whatever part of yourself you deny, just gets bigger and bigger until it takes you over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke nods sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I don't really want to be a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think for some, making it stop is more important than knowing who you are. It was for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe for me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, you're Morphescent. The key is to have sex with another Z. You become Adulmorphic. Your gender locks. You can't just change anytime you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Z?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I came all the way out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why you keep tryin' to get me in the sack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought maybe I could save you some distress. But you say you're not attracted to me. For it to work, both of us have to be into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now? Okay.   Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning dew. Acres of empty grass.   Luke sits at the top a hill by his dad's grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that Christmas when Keen and me accidentally set the Scofields' house on fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that burning shingle drifted over and lit up the Robertson's place? The whole town was ready to lynch us, and we snuck back home... Two AM, you were up drinkin' coffee,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tugs out hunks of grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were gonna' kill us. But you just looked me right in the eye, and said, "Son, there's leftover pizza in the fridge."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear rims his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the coolest thing anyone ever said. Dad, I'm in such trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like if I let this thing in, it's all over. But I don't know what else to do. Guess you can't figure out who you are, until you accept who you might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ORLANDO'S BED & BREAKFAST - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Department store shopping bags and boxes are strewn acros the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney checks herself out in the full-length mirror.   A gray tuxedo jacket over lingerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant work floor of the abandoned mill.   Sunlight be through holes in the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, on roller blades, practices guiding the hockey puck along the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops when he notices the figure watching him from out the giant metal doors:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luca in the blue dress, on roller blades, hockey stick in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about the last person I expected to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can show you a few moves if you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   What the hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luca demonstrates hockey technique, expertly guiding a ho puck through an obstacle course of broken equipment, timb and sawdust piles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the while, she dodges Max's attempts to steal the puc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max finally gets it, which riles Luca. She hip checks Max They swerve to avoid a pipe, crash-landing on top of each other on a sawdust pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bust out LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're better than Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I taught him everything he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luca pulls away from Max, suddenly self-conscious that Ma leg is on top of hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward from the broken connection, they gaze up at the b sky through a hole in the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you left town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn to speak Italian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tourist stuff. "I'll have the spaghetti bolognese." "How much for a room?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Italy. In New York. Someday, though. Want to go with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max leans over and KISSES Luca.   She responds, tentative first,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: then as she grows more confident,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her face REDDENS, she GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luca pulls back, self-conscious, confused.    She brushes sawdust off her dress, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Of course.   I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up, Luca sees Keenan, staring at them from across floor, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan exits out through the giant doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you and he...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really none of my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm sorry.    I shouldn't've come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands, brushes off the sawdust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't say you're "just visiting." That you "need to leave." I'm the one who needs to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max skates off across the giant shop floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Semi Truck is parked alone in the middle of the aspha From inside the cab, the blue dress flips over the rolled down window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan leans against a tractor, rolls his eyes, and twist open another beer, which he gulps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke hops down from the truck cab wearing Langford U. swe and a T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan sits on the running board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what the FUCK is goin' on?! You do wanna' be a girl? You're into guys now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I don't know exactly.    I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan downs his beer, pensive.   He crushes the can and it, SMACKING a garbage can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Michelle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to be sure. I am now. Come on, it's sort of a Catch-22. I make out with a girl, I start turning into one. You gotta' admit, it's a little weird, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly uncomfortable sitting so close to Luke, Keenan stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get outta' here.  You want a ride somewhere? Janine's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go see her?   Think you're more her type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan picks up his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see ya' round, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "See me around?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm gonna' find my own place, okay?   This is gettin' too fuckin' weird for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm goin' to Dr. Catchadourian's tonight. To make this stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. I've had it with all this crap. I mean, you gonna' start hittin' on me next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right Keenan, you and me: let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keenan rides off, leaving Luke shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SYDNEY'S BED & BREAKFAST - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney wears a stunning black silk evening gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small Greek statues now adorn the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I really did need to face it head on in order to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was courageous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls, are just, I don't know. It's a different energy. They're soft and warm, they can make a guy feel complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I have incontrovertible proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luca stares at Max, and then down at his ankle, at the TA OF A GREEN BIRD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max meets her eyes,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and it finally dawns on Luca,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing, in shock, and now putting it all together,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she LUNGES for him, nailing him to the ground, kissing hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She RIPS Max's T-shirt as they fall to the asphalt, knock over oil cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passion.   Unbridled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luca manhandles Max, shoving him against a pile of huge tires, as Max's face transforms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle slams back onto the crabgrass. She pulls Luca toward her as Luca's face transforms into Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Michelle roll on the crabgrass, kissing,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRANSFORMING as they roll, into Luca and Max and Michelle Luke and Luca -or was that Max?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White gauze curtains billow in the morning breeze. The su first rays light up the down comforter and white pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle stirs slowly, then BOLTS AWAKE.       She grabs vise grip around his torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He awakens, groggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you.    ...Good morning.   What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle bites her lip, embarrassed, releases him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still think I'm going to bolt, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And leave me stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, a gender pre-nup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.   I have to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nuzzles him playfully.      Luke glances at the clock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only place I'm going is back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can't show up at work like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, folds into her.
